intro: Thesium atratum, commonly known as the black thesium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, dark purple to black flowers that bloom in clusters during the winter months. Its leaves are leathery and evergreen, providing year-round foliage. Thesium atratum is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
